title: If I Had a $300 Gift Card to Nordstrom, I'd Buy These Items From the Half-Yearly Sale
text: Nordstrom’s Half-Yearly Sale is one of the most anticipated shopping events of the year, and for good reason. Whether you're looking to refresh your wardrobe, or just searching for great deals on high-quality items, this sale is the place to be.The retailer is known for carrying high-end, premium brands, and the Half-Yearly Sale gives you the chance to shop these luxury labels at a fraction of the price. From designer apparel and accessories, you can snag deals of up to 60%. Luckily, that makes $300 go a lot further. Below is a curation of under-$300 products that will leave you with no regrets. Nordstrom Oversize Cashmere Turtleneck Sweater Snagging cashmere on sale is the best. Reformation Small Vittoria Leather Tote The perfect everyday bag. Treasure & Bond Turtleneck Sweater & Other Stories Merino Wool Top High-quality basics are always a good investment. Vince Long Sleeve Rib Polo A total steal on this Vince sweater. Reformation Brooklyn Organic Cotton Sweater This statement sweater has adorable details. Steve Madden Dagne Knee High Boot This sculptural boot is the ideal winter footwear. DAZE Far Out High Waist Wide Leg Jeans A very trusty pair of jeans. Zella Cozy Quarter Zip Rib Pullover Sweater FRAME Le Palazzo Ankle Wide Leg Jeans Frame's best selling Le Palazzo on sale. Nordstrom Crewneck Side Slit Wool & Cashmere Sweater DAZE Sundaze High Waist Straight Leg Jeans If you like them in blue you'll love them in black. Schutz Maryana Pointed Toe Knee High Boot Comfortable heeled boots for the win. Topshop High Pile Fleece Lined Trench Coat This trench coat is extra warm with a fleece lining. AFRM Rhett Leopard Print Carpenter Jeans One of the top trends of this season. Good American Scoop Neck Bodysuit Burgundy is everywhere right now. Elevate your white tank top game with this Reformation top. Sam Edelman Michaela Rhinestone Mary Jane Flat The fashion crowd is behind this shoe. Topshop Sasha Ruched Faux Leather Shoulder Bag A huge deal on this classic shoulder bag. A.L.C. Cooper Stripe Knit Polo A really luxe knit more than 50% off. Cole Haan Gema Waterproof Lug Sole Tall Boot These waterproof boots are fashionable and functional. Topshop Oversize Cotton Bomber Jacket An easy maintanance piece. Good American Good Curve Front Slit Bootcut Jeans All in Favor Bias Cut Satin Midi Skirt This midi skirt has a cool vintage feel. Sporty & Rich Stripe Cotton Button-Up Shirt Grab the shorts to make it a set. The universal favorite brand for fashion editors. Topshop Boxy Sweater Vest Jeffrey Campbell Vader Pointed Toe Mule These shoes look much more expensive than $85. Copelyn is a freelance fashion and accessory editor. She formerly worked for Who What Wear as an associate shopping editor and is based in New York City. She writes about fashion and accessory trends in addition to creating original content. Before her time at Who What Wear, Copelyn was at Bustle Digital Group, working on the accessory market for cover shoots and fashion features across Nylon, The Zoe Report, Bustle, Romper, and Elite Daily. Copelyn also previously worked at InStyle and Cosmopolitan in the fashion and accessory departments on shopping and fashion market. Copelyn has a journalism degree from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. In her spare time, Copelyn freelances in graphic and web design in the fashion-and-lifestyle space. She also loves to upcycle clothing and home décor as well as collect an embarrassing number of colorful sneakers and experiment with her hair color.
html:
Nordstrom’s Half-Yearly Sale is one of the most anticipated shopping events of the year, and for good reason. Whether you're looking to refresh your wardrobe, or just searching for great deals on high-quality items, this sale is the place to be.

The retailer is known for carrying high-end, premium brands, and the Half-Yearly Sale gives you the chance to shop these luxury labels at a fraction of the price. From designer apparel and accessories, you can snag deals of up to 60%. Luckily, that makes $300 go a lot further. Below is a curation of under-$300 products that will leave you with no regrets.

Nordstrom

Oversize Cashmere Turtleneck Sweater

Snagging cashmere on sale is the best.

Reformation

Small Vittoria Leather Tote

The perfect everyday bag.

Treasure & Bond

Turtleneck Sweater

& Other Stories

Merino Wool Top

High-quality basics are always a good investment.

Long Sleeve Rib Polo

Brooklyn Organic Cotton Sweater

This statement sweater has adorable details.

This sculptural boot is the ideal winter footwear.

Comfortable heeled boots for the win.

High Pile Fleece Lined Trench Coat

This trench coat is extra warm with a fleece lining.

Rhett Leopard Print Carpenter Jeans

One of the top trends of this season.

Burgundy is everywhere right now.

Elevate your white tank top game with this Reformation top.

Michaela Rhinestone Mary Jane Flat

The fashion crowd is behind this shoe.

Sasha Ruched Faux Leather Shoulder Bag

A huge deal on this classic shoulder bag.

Cooper Stripe Knit Polo

A really luxe knit more than 50% off.

Gema Waterproof Lug Sole Tall Boot

These waterproof boots are fashionable and functional.

Oversize Cotton Bomber Jacket

An easy maintanance piece.

Good Curve Front Slit Bootcut Jeans

This midi skirt has a cool vintage feel.

Grab the shorts to make it a set.

The universal favorite brand for fashion editors.

Jeffrey Campbell

These shoes look much more expensive than $85.

Copelyn is a freelance fashion and accessory editor. She formerly worked for Who What Wear as an associate shopping editor and is based in New York City. She writes about fashion and accessory trends in addition to creating original content. Before her time at Who What Wear, Copelyn was at Bustle Digital Group, working on the accessory market for cover shoots and fashion features across Nylon, The Zoe Report, Bustle, Romper, and Elite Daily. Copelyn also previously worked at InStyle and Cosmopolitan in the fashion and accessory departments on shopping and fashion market. Copelyn has a journalism degree from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. In her spare time, Copelyn freelances in graphic and web design in the fashion-and-lifestyle space. She also loves to upcycle clothing and home décor as well as collect an embarrassing number of colorful sneakers and experiment with her hair color.
